definition: a four-wheeled road vehicle that is powered by an engine and is able to carry a small number of people.
engaging or ready to engage in physically energetic pursuits.
move rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps.

an oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate, usually containing a developing embryo. The eggs of birds are enclosed in a chalky shell, while those of reptiles are in a leathery membrane.
an area of land and its buildings used for growing crops and rearing animals, typically under the control of one owner or manager.
frozen water, a brittle transparent crystalline solid.
perceive with the ear the sound made by (someone or something).

a large keyboard musical instrument with a wooden case enclosing a soundboard and metal strings, which are struck by hammers when the keys are depressed. The strings' vibration is stopped by dampers when the keys are released and can be regulated for length and volume by two or three pedals.
any institution at which instruction is given in a particular discipline.
